meanings.definition: To surpass in storytelling or exaggeration.
meanings.sent1: She can outfable anyone with her wild tales.
meanings.sent2: His stories always manage to outfable reality.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as Tim tried to outfable the teacher's explanation.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination could outfable even the most fantastical movies.
meanings.sent5: The old man's stories were so outrageous, they could outfable a fairy tale.

meanings.definition: To be more incredible or unbelievable than.
meanings.sent1: The magic show seemed to outfable all logic.
meanings.sent2: The plot twist in the movie completely outfabled my expectations.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to sleep all day could outfable even the laziest person.
meanings.sent4: The speed of the cheetah outfabled that of any other land animal.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset outfabled any painting I had ever seen.
